most_active_tickets.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
LTM gets gunged up over time

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: Issues with selection, dependencies, and authentication
common_issues.description: Users reported persistent selection issues, including unintended selection with arrow keys and mouse clicks, preventing copy-pasting.  Other reported issues include failure of the "Ensure core dependencies" step during installation and unsuccessful authentication despite purchasing Pieces OS Pro.  Suggested solutions include checking system dependencies, reinstalling the application, and verifying account credentials.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
related_issues.text:
it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not sure how to make it happen but its **extremely** annoying, it seems like it thinks I'm holding "shift" or "mouse 1", i use the arrow keys a lot but when this bug is active it selects instead of moving, when i try to click when its active it also selects, i cant ctrl + v when its active :(

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to initialize due to missing platform directory
common_issues.description: Users on Windows and Linux encounter "MissingPlatformDirectoryException" during initialization, specifically when determining the database location.  The "Ensure core dependencies" or OS boot process fails.  Suggested solutions include restarting the machine and checking data directory permissions. If the issue persists, contact support.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces software incompatibility issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing incompatibility issues with Pieces software components, including the Raycast extension on macOS (v1.100.3), core dependencies on Linux (Pieces OS 4.3.1), and authentication problems on Windows (Pieces OS 12.1.1).  The Raycast extension triggers update errors, the Linux setup encounters a "Retry Step" message during dependency checks, and Windows users face authentication failures impacting Pro membership access.  Suggested solutions include updating the Raycast extension, verifying core dependencies on Linux, and troubleshooting authentication issues on Windows, potentially involving account re-authentication or support assistance.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)

common_issues.title: Subscription and Authentication Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty upgrading subscriptions and authenticating their Pro accounts.  Upgrade attempts result in a blank checkout page with zero values, eventually failing.  Authentication issues prevent Pro users from accessing their memberships.  This affects both macOS and Windows users on Pieces OS 12.1.1. Further investigation into checkout and authentication processes is needed.

related_issues.title: Unable to upgrade subscription
related_issues.text:
Unable to upgrade subscription
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Every time I click "Upgrade" from ANYWHERE - to upgrade to pro, it leads to a page that is blank except for a minimal table, like the bones of a cart checkout view, with like price, subtotal, total, etc. except there are no words, and all the values are 0.00 (zero dollars).. it stays like this for a minute, then says it isn't working properly and returns to the desktop view or the view I was in before. 

been happening for weeks

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Pieces OS integration with other applications, like Claude Code in VS Code, and general LTM functionality. Issues include SSE connection hangs, LTM performance degradation over time, and "Ensure core dependencies" step failing during setup.  Suggested solutions include checking MCP server configuration, clearing LTM data (though the button is reported broken), and reinstalling/reinitializing Pieces OS and the Desktop app.

related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running

related_issues.title: LTM gets gunged up over time
related_issues.text:
LTM gets gunged up over time
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS: Issues with selection, dependencies, and authentication" common issue, focusing on selection bugs, dependency installation failures, and authentication problems.

Address the "Pieces OS fails to initialize due to missing platform directory" error on Windows and Linux by investigating data directory permissions and providing clearer instructions for users encountering this issue.

Investigate and resolve the incompatibility issues between Pieces software components, specifically the Raycast extension update errors on macOS, core dependency issues on Linux, and authentication failures on Windows.
Resolve the subscription upgrade issue causing a blank checkout page and zero values, and ensure Pro users can successfully authenticate and access their memberships.
Improve Pieces OS and Desktop App integration, focusing on the SSE connection hangs with Claude Code in VS Code, LTM performance degradation, and the broken "Clear LTM Data" button.
